unnormalised: Bus services across Maharashtra and Goa were severely disrupted due to the strike called by the Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) employees. Approx. 80% of buses remained off the roads, causing major inconvenience to commuters. Key routes like Mumbai-Pune and Pune-Nashik saw massive delays.
normalised: Bus services across Maharashtra and Goa were severely disrupted due to the strike called by the Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (M-S-R-T-C) employees. Approximately eighty percent of buses remained off the roads, causing major inconvenience to commuters. Key routes like Mumbai-Pune and Pune-Nashik saw massive delays.

unnormalised: The strike, which began on 10/11/2024, demands better wages and benefits for MSRTC staff. Passengers were seen stranded at bus depots, including the busy Dadar terminus in Mumbai. Many had to resort to private buses or auto-rickshaws, which often charge exorbitant fares during such disruptions. The Goa-Mumbai highway (NH 66) also experienced traffic jams because of reduced bus availability.
normalised: The strike, which began on tenth November two thousand and twenty four, demands better wages and benefits for M-S-R-T-C staff. Passengers were seen stranded at bus depots, including the busy Dadar terminus in Mumbai. Many had to resort to private buses or auto-rickshaws, which often charge exorbitant fares during such disruptions. The Goa-Mumbai highway (N-H sixty six) also experienced traffic jams because of reduced bus availability.

unnormalised: As of 16:00 hrs today, talks between the MSRTC union and the state govt. are still underway. Commuters are advised to check MSRTC's website and social media for updates before planning their travel. The earliest normalcy is expected is by 12/11/2024, depending on the outcome of the negotiations.
normalised: As of sixteen zero zero hours today, talks between the M-S-R-T-C union and the state government are still underway. Commuters are advised to check M-S-R-T-C's website and social media for updates before planning their travel. The earliest normalcy is expected is by twelfth November two thousand and twenty four, depending on the outcome of the negotiations.
